context.description: Acme Sales is a B2B SaaS company selling workflow automation to mid-market enterprises. The team focuses on outbound prospecting, discovery calls, and pipeline management.

product.primary: Workflow automation platform — automate repetitive business processes across departments
product.secondary: Integration marketplace — connect to 200+ enterprise tools
product.value_prop: Reduce operational costs by 30% while improving process compliance and visibility.

sales_methodology.challenger_approach: Lead with industry insight the prospect hasn't considered. Reframe manual processes as a competitive disadvantage.
sales_methodology.qualification_threshold: $5M revenue minimum, 50+ employees, identifiable process pain

typical_objections: We already use Zapier / Make for automation
Our IT team builds custom integrations
We're in the middle of another software rollout
Budget is locked until next fiscal year
context.objection_handling: For existing tools: compare enterprise features (audit trails, compliance, role-based access). For IT-built: total cost of ownership analysis. For timing: offer a pilot program. For budget: ROI model showing payback within 6 months.

custom_fields.MEDDICC Score: 0-7 integer (one point per MEDDICC element confirmed)
custom_fields.Process Volume: number of processes candidate for automation

key_workflows.prospect_enrichment: Before any outreach: research the company (revenue, employee count, tech stack, vertical context). Build a preliminary ROI estimate. Add to CRM with MEDDICC pre-filled as much as possible from public info.
key_workflows.stale_deal_alerts: Daily scan of CRM for deals where last activity > 14 days. Surface them in morning briefing. Flag if decision timeline has passed without movement.
key_workflows.meddicc_tracking: After every call: update CRM notes with which MEDDICC elements were confirmed, disputed, or still unknown. Recalculate MEDDICC Score.
key_workflows.demo_prep: Before scheduled demos: pull prospect info from CRM, research recent company news, prepare tailored talking points, create a one-pager with relevant case studies.

competitive_context.differentiation: Purpose-built for mid-market. Faster time-to-value than enterprise tools. More governance than SMB tools. Industry-specific templates.

context.seasonal_rhythm: Q4 is budget season — good time for year-end deals. Q1 is new fiscal year — teams evaluating new tools. Summer tends to be slower (vacations, delayed decisions).
context.brand_voice: Professional, consultative, insight-led. Lead with the prospect's pain, not your features. Never pushy. Frame everything as a business outcome.

pre_approved_actions: Update CRM contact notes after meetings
Flag stale deals in daily briefing
Prepare demo talking points from CRM data
